grade1-addition-subtraction-to-20.description: Adding and subtracting numbers within 20, including crossing the ten, fact families, and mental calculation strategies
grade1-addition-subtraction-to-20.name: Addition and Subtraction to 20

grade1-introduction-to-measurement.description: Comparing lengths, using non-standard units, and understanding basic time concepts
grade1-introduction-to-measurement.name: Introduction to Measurement

grade1-money.description: Recognizing coins and bills, counting money, and solving simple purchase problems
grade1-money.name: Money

grade1-number-sense-to-20.description: Counting, reading, writing, comparing, and ordering numbers from 0 to 20; understanding quantity and number relationships
grade1-number-sense-to-20.name: Number Sense to 20

grade1-patterns-and-data.description: Recognizing, continuing, and creating patterns; collecting and representing simple data
grade1-patterns-and-data.name: Patterns and Data

grade1-plane-shapes.description: Identifying, naming, and describing basic 2D shapes
grade1-plane-shapes.name: Plane Shapes

grade1-probability-basics.description: Understanding chance and likelihood using vocabulary like certain, possible, and impossible through simple everyday situations
grade1-probability-basics.name: Probability Basics

grade1-solid-shapes.description: Identifying and naming 3D shapes (cube, sphere, cylinder, cone, cuboid) and relating them to real-world objects
grade1-solid-shapes.name: Solid Shapes

grade1-spatial-orientation.description: Understanding and using position words to describe locations and follow directions
grade1-spatial-orientation.name: Spatial Orientation

grade1-symmetry.description: Recognizing axial symmetry through folding and mirror activities, identifying symmetric shapes, and creating symmetric patterns
grade1-symmetry.name: Symmetry

grade2-addition-subtraction-to-100.description: Adding and subtracting numbers within 100 using mental strategies, with and without regrouping, and solving multi-step word problems
grade2-addition-subtraction-to-100.name: Addition and Subtraction to 100

grade2-geometry-and-symmetry.description: Deepening understanding of 2D and 3D shapes, identifying and creating symmetric figures, and working with lines of symmetry
grade2-geometry-and-symmetry.name: Geometry and Symmetry

grade2-introduction-to-chance.description: Understanding certain, possible, and impossible events through simple experiments
grade2-introduction-to-chance.name: Introduction to Chance

grade2-introduction-to-division.description: Understanding division through sharing and grouping strategies, connecting to multiplication, and building foundational division facts
grade2-introduction-to-division.name: Introduction to Division

grade2-introduction-to-multiplication.description: Understanding multiplication as repeated addition, arrays, equal groups, and foundational times tables (2, 5, 10)
grade2-introduction-to-multiplication.name: Introduction to Multiplication

grade2-measurement-skills.description: Measuring length, understanding time, and comparing measurements
grade2-measurement-skills.name: Measurement Skills

grade2-money-and-currency.description: Working with Euro coins and bills up to 100€, using € and ct notation, adding and subtracting money amounts, calculating change, and solving shopping problems
grade2-money-and-currency.name: Money and Currency

grade2-numbers-to-100.description: Understanding place value with tens and ones, reading, writing, comparing numbers to 100, using hundred chart and number line
grade2-numbers-to-100.name: Numbers to 100

grade2-patterns-and-data-representation.description: Number sequences; data collection; tally charts; simple bar graphs; interpreting data
grade2-patterns-and-data-representation.name: Patterns and Data Representation

grade3-advanced-geometry.description: Exploring pyramids, cones, and cylinders; understanding nets of 3D shapes; deepened symmetry work
grade3-advanced-geometry.name: Advanced Geometry

grade3-area.description: Covering with unit squares; comparing areas; area as measurement
grade3-area.name: Introduction to Area

grade3-arithmetic-laws.description: Understanding and applying commutative, associative, and distributive properties to make calculations more efficient
grade3-arithmetic-laws.name: Arithmetic Laws and Properties

grade3-data-and-combinatorics.description: Collecting, organizing, and interpreting data; systematic counting and simple combinations
grade3-data-and-combinatorics.name: Data and Combinatorics

grade3-length-measurement.description: Measuring with mm, cm, m, km; unit conversions; estimation and comparison of lengths
grade3-length-measurement.name: Length Measurement

grade3-measurement-mass-volume.description: Understanding and working with grams, kilograms, milliliters, and liters through measuring, comparing, and converting
grade3-measurement-mass-volume.name: Measurement - Mass and Volume

grade3-money-advanced.description: Working with amounts up to 1000 Euro, using decimal notation, handling 100€, 200€, and 500€ bills, solving multi-step shopping problems, and budget planning
grade3-money-advanced.name: Advanced Money Skills

grade3-multiplication-division-strategie.description: Half-written methods for multiplication, multiplying by 10 and 100, and division with remainder
grade3-multiplication-division-strategie.name: Multiplication and Division Strategies

grade3-multiplication-tables.description: Mastering all times tables 1-10 with automatic recall and understanding inverse operations (division facts)
grade3-multiplication-tables.name: Multiplication Tables

grade3-numbers-to-1000.description: Understanding place value with hundreds, tens, and ones; reading, writing, comparing, and ordering numbers; rounding; recognizing number patterns
grade3-numbers-to-1000.name: Numbers to 1000

grade3-perimeter.description: Calculating the perimeter of shapes by adding side lengths; working with rectangles, squares, triangles, and polygons
grade3-perimeter.name: Perimeter

grade3-time-and-duration.description: Reading clocks, calculating time spans, understanding calendar relationships, and working with units of time
grade3-time-and-duration.name: Time and Duration

grade3-written-addition-and-subtraction.description: Standard algorithms for multi-digit addition and subtraction with regrouping
grade3-written-addition-and-subtraction.name: Written Addition and Subtraction

grade4-area-perimeter.description: Calculating area and perimeter of rectangles and squares; using square units; distinguishing between area and perimeter; solving word problems with missing dimensions
grade4-area-perimeter.name: Area and Perimeter

grade4-combinatorics.description: Finding all possibilities systematically using tree diagrams, organized lists, and tables to solve combination and arrangement problems
grade4-combinatorics.name: Combinatorics and Systematic Counting

grade4-data-probability.description: Collecting and organizing data from surveys and experiments; creating and interpreting bar charts, pictographs, and tables; calculating simple averages; understanding likelihood and probability events
grade4-data-probability.name: Data Analysis and Probability

grade4-fractions.description: Understanding fractions as parts of a whole, fraction notation, visual representation, comparing and ordering fractions with same denominators, recognizing equivalent fractions, and applying fractions in everyday contexts
grade4-fractions.name: Introduction to Fractions

grade4-geometry-spatial.description: Properties of 2D and 3D shapes; symmetry and lines; spatial visualization; nets of geometric solids; parallel and perpendicular relationships
grade4-geometry-spatial.name: Geometry and Spatial Reasoning

grade4-measurement-units.description: Converting between units of length, mass, volume, and time; understanding decimal notation for measurements; estimating and solving word problems with measurements
grade4-measurement-units.name: Measurement and Unit Conversion

grade4-money-decimals.description: Understanding euro and cent notation with decimals; adding, subtracting, and multiplying money amounts; making change and calculating totals; comparing prices and converting between euros and cents
grade4-money-decimals.name: Money and Decimal Notation

grade4-numbers-to-million.description: Understanding place value with six digits; reading, writing, comparing, and ordering numbers; rounding to thousands and beyond; recognizing patterns in large numbers
grade4-numbers-to-million.name: Numbers to 1,000,000

grade4-patterns-equations.description: Recognizing and extending number patterns, finding sequence rules, understanding variables as placeholders, solving simple one-step equations, and describing mathematical relationships
grade4-patterns-equations.name: Patterns and Simple Equations

grade4-scale-maps.description: Reading and creating floor plans and maps; understanding scale as a ratio; calculating real distances from map distances; spatial orientation and direction
grade4-scale-maps.name: Scale and Maps

grade4-time-calendar.description: Reading analog and digital clocks in 24-hour format; converting between time units; calculating time durations and elapsed time; working with calendars including days, weeks, months, and years
grade4-time-calendar.name: Time and Calendar

grade4-volume-unit-cubes.description: Understanding volume by counting unit cubes and comparing volumes of 3D shapes
grade4-volume-unit-cubes.name: Volume with Unit Cubes

grade4-written-multiplication-division.description: Mastering standard written algorithms for multi-digit multiplication and division; understanding when to apply each operation; solving real-world problems
grade4-written-multiplication-division.name: Written Multiplication and Division

grade5-angles.description: Understanding angle types, measuring angles with a protractor, estimating angles, and recognizing angle relationships
grade5-angles.name: Angles and Measurement

grade5-area-perimeter-advanced.description: Calculate area and perimeter of rectangles, squares, triangles, and composite shapes
grade5-area-perimeter-advanced.name: Area and Perimeter - Advanced

grade5-arithmetic-operations.description: Written methods for all four operations, order of operations, estimation and verification
grade5-arithmetic-operations.name: Arithmetic Operations

grade5-data-collection-charts.description: Collecting, organizing, and representing data using tables, bar charts, pictographs, and line graphs
grade5-data-collection-charts.name: Data Collection and Charts

grade5-decimals.description: Understanding decimal place value, converting between fractions and decimals, performing operations with decimals, and rounding
grade5-decimals.name: Decimals

grade5-divisibility-prime-numbers.description: Applying divisibility rules for 2, 3, 5, 9, and 10, identifying prime and composite numbers, performing prime factorization using factor trees, and determining GCD and LCM of numbers
grade5-divisibility-prime-numbers.name: Divisibility and Prime Numbers

grade5-fractions-operations.description: Adding and subtracting fractions with same and different denominators, multiplying fractions by whole numbers, and simplifying fractions to lowest terms
grade5-fractions-operations.name: Operations with Fractions

grade5-geometry-basics.description: Points, lines, rays, segments, parallel and perpendicular lines, and basic geometric notation
grade5-geometry-basics.name: Basic Geometric Elements

grade5-natural-numbers-large.description: Understanding natural numbers beyond 1 million, place value to billions, Roman numerals, and comparing different number systems
grade5-natural-numbers-large.name: Large Natural Numbers

grade5-negative-numbers.description: Introduction to integers, number line representation, comparing and ordering integers, and real-world contexts
grade5-negative-numbers.name: Negative Numbers

grade5-units-measurement.description: Advanced metric unit conversions, calculations with mixed units, and choosing appropriate measurement units for different contexts
grade5-units-measurement.name: Units and Measurement

grade5-volume.description: Calculate volume using formulas, convert between cubic units, and relate volume to capacity
grade5-volume.name: Volume of Cuboids and Cubes

grade6-angles-advanced.description: Measuring and drawing angles accurately, identifying angle relationships including vertical, corresponding, and adjacent angles, and constructing angle bisectors
grade6-angles-advanced.name: Angles and Angle Relationships

grade6-area-formulas.description: Deriving and applying area formulas for parallelograms, triangles, and trapezoids; calculating surface areas of simple solids using decomposition and complementation strategies
grade6-area-formulas.name: Area Formulas

grade6-combined-operations.description: Term structures, order of operations, distributive property, and multi-step problems with fractions, decimals, and whole numbers
grade6-combined-operations.name: Combined Operations with Rational Numbers

grade6-coordinate-system.description: Understanding the Cartesian coordinate system with all four quadrants, plotting and reading points with positive and negative coordinates, calculating distances, and describing geometric relationships
grade6-coordinate-system.name: Coordinate System

grade6-data-diagrams.description: Determining absolute and relative frequencies, displaying data using circle and column diagrams, calculating and interpreting arithmetic mean, recognizing manipulative presentations in data visualization
grade6-data-diagrams.name: Data and Diagrams

grade6-decimal-fractions.description: Understanding place values in decimals, rounding, converting between fractions and decimals, and distinguishing terminating from repeating decimals
grade6-decimal-fractions.name: Decimal Fractions

grade6-fractions-basics.description: Interpreting fractions as parts of wholes, comparing fractions using multiple strategies, extending and reducing fractions while preserving value, representing fractions on number lines including negative fractions, and connecting percentages to fraction notation
grade6-fractions-basics.name: Fractions and Fractional Numbers

grade6-geometric-constructions.description: Constructing perpendicular and parallel lines, performing axial and point reflections
grade6-geometric-constructions.name: Geometric Constructions

grade6-integer-operations.description: Adding and subtracting integers using number line models and sign rules, understanding absolute value in calculations, and applying integer operations to real-world contexts
grade6-integer-operations.name: Integer Operations

grade6-percentages.description: Solving everyday percentage problems including discounts and interest, applying the basic percentage equation (base value × percentage rate = percentage value), and distinguishing between percent and percentage points
grade6-percentages.name: Percentages

grade6-proportionality.description: Understanding ratios as comparisons, recognizing proportional relationships, using ratio tables and the rule of three, and distinguishing proportional from non-proportional situations
grade6-proportionality.name: Proportionality and Ratios

grade6-rational-addition-subtraction.description: Adding and subtracting fractions with same and different denominators, mixed numbers, and decimals using computational strategies and verifying results through estimation
grade6-rational-addition-subtraction.name: Adding and Subtracting Rational Numbers

grade6-rational-multiplication-division.description: Computing products and quotients of fractions using meaningful representations, applying reciprocals for division, calculating powers with rational bases and natural or negative integer exponents, and using computational advantages to simplify calculations
grade6-rational-multiplication-division.name: Multiplying and Dividing Rational Numbers

grade6-volume.description: Calculate volumes of cuboids and prisms using formulas, convert between volume units, and solve problems through decomposition and complementation strategies
grade6-volume.name: Volume of Prisms

grade7-algebraic-terms.description: Setting up, interpreting, and transforming algebraic terms with variables including powers
grade7-algebraic-terms.name: Algebraic Terms

grade7-angle-relationships.description: Understanding angle properties at intersecting lines, with parallel lines, and in polygons
grade7-angle-relationships.name: Angle Relationships

grade7-congruence-triangles.description: Congruence theorems (SSS, SAS, ASA, AAS) and constructing triangles from given elements
grade7-congruence-triangles.name: Congruence and Triangle Construction

grade7-linear-equations.description: Solving linear equations with one variable including one-step, two-step, variables on both sides, and real-world word problems
grade7-linear-equations.name: Linear Equations

grade7-parallel-translation.description: Parallel displacement as congruence mapping, translation vectors, coordinate calculations
grade7-parallel-translation.name: Parallel Translation and Vectors

grade7-percentage-applications.description: Advanced percentage calculations including interest, discounts, and multi-step problems
grade7-percentage-applications.name: Percentage Applications

grade7-powers-exponents.description: Understanding power notation as repeated multiplication, applying power laws including product rule, quotient rule, and power of power, simplifying expressions with integer exponents, and working with powers of variables
grade7-powers-exponents.name: Powers and Exponents

grade7-proportionality.description: Recognizing and applying direct and inverse proportional relationships, creating ratio tables, graphing proportional functions, and distinguishing between proportional and non-proportional situations in real-world contexts
grade7-proportionality.name: Proportionality

grade7-statistical-measures.description: Calculate and interpret mean, median, mode, range, quartiles, and boxplots for statistical data analysis and comparison
grade7-statistical-measures.name: Statistical Measures

grade7-symmetry-constructions.description: Constructing symmetric figures, perpendicular bisectors, angle bisectors, and geometric loci
grade7-symmetry-constructions.name: Symmetry and Geometric Constructions

grade7-thales-theorem.description: Applying Thales' theorem and its converse to identify right angles, construct tangent lines, and solve geometric problems
grade7-thales-theorem.name: Thales' Theorem

grade8-circles.description: Circle circumference, area, understanding pi, and applications with composite shapes
grade8-circles.name: Circles

grade8-fractional-equations.description: Solving equations with algebraic fractions, checking for extraneous solutions, and rearranging formulas in scientific contexts
grade8-fractional-equations.name: Fractional Equations

grade8-fractional-terms.description: Operations on algebraic fractions - simplifying, expanding, adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing fractional terms
grade8-fractional-terms.name: Fractional Terms

grade8-functions-basics.description: Understanding the function concept as a unique assignment, distinguishing function terminology (function term, graph, domain, range), using tables and diagrams to represent functions, and determining function values and intersection points
grade8-functions-basics.name: Functions and Terms

grade8-integer-exponents.description: Understanding negative and zero exponents, applying power rules with integer exponents, writing and calculating with scientific notation, and simplifying complex exponential expressions
grade8-integer-exponents.name: Integer Exponents

grade8-laplace-probability.description: Random experiments, Laplace formula P(E)=|E|/|Ω|, counting principles, tree diagrams for multi-stage experiments, relative frequency, law of large numbers
grade8-laplace-probability.name: Laplace Experiments

grade8-linear-functions.description: Understanding and working with linear functions y = mx + t, including graphing, interpreting slope and y-intercept, finding zeros and intersection points, and solving linear inequalities
grade8-linear-functions.name: Linear Functions

grade8-linear-systems.description: Solving systems of two linear equations with two unknowns using graphical methods and substitution, understanding solution cases (unique, none, infinite)
grade8-linear-systems.name: Linear Equation Systems

grade8-prisms-cylinders.description: Calculate surface area and volume of prisms and cylinders, draw and interpret nets, and apply the V = base area × height formula to solve real-world problems
grade8-prisms-cylinders.name: Prisms and Cylinders

grade8-rational-functions.description: Understanding and working with rational functions of the form f(x) = a/(x+b) + c, including domain restrictions, asymptotes, graphing, and indirect proportionality as a special case
grade8-rational-functions.name: Elementary Rational Functions

grade9-binomial-formulas.description: Master the three binomial formulas for expanding and factoring algebraic expressions efficiently
grade9-binomial-formulas.name: Binomial Formulas

grade9-compound-probability.description: Understanding compound events through set notation, Venn diagrams, contingency tables, and calculating probabilities of unions and intersections using the addition rule
grade9-compound-probability.name: Compound Probability

grade9-power-functions.description: Understanding power functions with various exponents, their graphs, and relationships to radical notation
grade9-power-functions.name: Power Functions

grade9-pythagorean-theorem.description: Understanding and applying the Pythagorean theorem, its proof, converse, and practical applications in geometry and measurement
grade9-pythagorean-theorem.name: Pythagorean Theorem

grade9-quadratic-equations.description: Solving quadratic equations using factoring, completing the square, and quadratic formulas (p-q and abc form). Understanding the discriminant and applying solutions to real-world problems.
grade9-quadratic-equations.name: Quadratic Equations

grade9-similarity.description: Understanding triangle similarity criteria, applying the intercept theorem, calculating proportional segments, and analyzing how scaling factors affect area and volume
grade9-similarity.name: Similarity and Proportionality

grade9-quadratic-functions.description: Study parabolas, their equations (vertex form, general form, factored form), parameter effects, graphing techniques, and key properties including range, zeros, and monotonicity.
grade9-quadratic-functions.name: Quadratic Functions

grade9-square-roots.description: Understanding square roots, simplifying radical expressions, rationalizing denominators, and exploring irrational numbers
grade9-square-roots.name: Square Roots and Radicals

grade9-right-triangle-trigonometry.description: Understanding sine, cosine, and tangent as ratios in right triangles, applying fundamental trigonometric identities, and solving practical surveying and physics problems
grade9-right-triangle-trigonometry.name: Right Triangle Trigonometry

grade9-sine-cosine-laws.description: Applying sine and cosine laws to solve non-right triangles, understanding unit circle visualization, and recognizing the Pythagorean theorem as a special case
grade9-sine-cosine-laws.name: Sine and Cosine Laws

grade9-systems-of-equations.description: Solving systems of three linear equations with three unknowns using substitution, elimination, and Gaussian elimination methods, including real-world modeling
grade9-systems-of-equations.name: Systems of Linear Equations (3 Variables)

grade10-exponential-functions.description: Exponential functions of the form b·aˣ, exponential growth and decay models, and comparison with linear growth
grade10-exponential-functions.name: Exponential Functions and Growth

grade10-logarithms.description: Understanding logarithms as inverse operations of exponentiation, calculating logarithm values, and solving exponential equations
grade10-logarithms.name: Logarithms

grade10-pyramids-cones.description: Calculate surface area and volume of pyramids and cones, draw and interpret nets, understand Cavalieri's principle, and solve multi-step spatial problems combining geometry with trigonometry
grade10-pyramids-cones.name: Pyramids and Cones

grade10-unit-circle-radians.description: Unit circle with radius 1, radian measure as alternative to degrees, and sine/cosine values for special angles from 0 to 2π
grade10-unit-circle-radians.name: Unit Circle and Radian Measure

grade10-trigonometric-functions.description: Understanding sine and cosine as periodic functions, analyzing parameter effects in transformations a·sin(b·(x+c))+d, and modeling periodic real-world phenomena
grade10-trigonometric-functions.name: Trigonometric Functions

grade10-polynomial-functions.description: Explore polynomial functions as sums of power functions, analyze zeros and multiplicity, sketch graphs using factored form, determine end behavior, and verify symmetry properties
grade10-polynomial-functions.name: Polynomial Functions

grade10-probability-simulation.description: Using Monte Carlo methods and spreadsheet simulations to approximate probabilities experimentally, exploring the law of large numbers and famous probability paradoxes
grade10-probability-simulation.name: Probability Simulation

grade10-compound-experiments.description: Tree diagrams, path rules, urn models for compound probability
grade10-compound-experiments.name: Compound Random Experiments

grade10-spheres.description: Understanding spheres as solids of revolution, calculating volume and surface area, and solving problems with hemispheres and composite solids
grade10-spheres.name: Spheres
